definition: Trading activities involving option contracts that give the right to buy or sell assets at specified prices.

positive_examples: The investor exercised her call options to purchase 100 shares at the strike price.
He implemented a covered call strategy to generate additional income from his stock holdings.
She decided to exercise her put options before expiration to lock in profits.
The trader used a butterfly spread strategy combining multiple option contracts.
After the stock price rose above $50, he exercised his call options immediately.
The portfolio manager employed a protective put strategy to hedge against market downturns.
negative_examples: The company issued new shares through a public stock offering.
She bought 200 shares of Microsoft on the open market.
The bond trader purchased $10,000 in corporate bonds at par value.
He sold his entire position in Apple stock for a capital gain.
The mutual fund manager rebalanced the portfolio by selling tech stocks.
They completed the merger by exchanging shares at the agreed ratio.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: StockTrading, BondTransaction, CommodityTrading, ForexTransaction, IPOActivity
